Tasks.Task Description: Identify the data types, volume, and retention policies for the archive storage. Determine access frequency and compliance requirements.
Plan the storage architecture, including the use of storage accounts, containers, and access tiers. Ensure scalability and cost optimization.
Provision a new Azure Storage Account with the required configurations, such as region, redundancy, and access tier settings.
Set up the archive tier for the storage account. Define policies for moving data to the archive tier based on access patterns and retention requirements.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure access control policies, including role-based access control (RBAC) and shared access signatures (SAS).
Define lifecycle management rules to automatically transition data between tiers and delete data after the retention period expires.
Verify the ability to upload, retrieve, and restore data from the archive tier. Test access permissions and performance metrics.
Set up monitoring for storage account metrics, such as capacity usage and access patterns. Configure alerts for unusual activity or errors.
Create detailed documentation of the storage account configuration, lifecycle policies, and security measures. Share documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing archive storage, including data retrieval, monitoring, and troubleshooting.
Schedule regular audits to ensure compliance with data retention policies and security standards. Verify that lifecycle management rules are functioning as intended.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of Archive Storage accounts. Identify and address any anomalies or potential issues.
Perform regular checks to ensure the integrity of archived data using Azure Storage's built-in data integrity features.
Audit and update access policies for Archive Storage accounts to ensure compliance with organizational security standards.
Analyze storage usage and costs to identify opportunities for optimization, such as moving data to lower-cost tiers or deleting unnecessary data.
Conduct security audits to ensure Archive Storage accounts are protected against unauthorized access and comply with regulatory requirements.
Perform periodic tests to ensure archived data can be successfully retrieved within the expected timeframes.
Rotate encryption keys used for Archive Storage accounts to maintain security and comply with best practices.
Regularly back up configuration settings for Archive Storage accounts to ensure quick recovery in case of accidental changes or failures.
Keep documentation for Archive Storage operations up-to-date, including procedures, configurations, and troubleshooting guides.
Conduct drills to prepare for potential incidents affecting Archive Storage, such as data breaches or service outages.
Evaluate Archive Storage performance against the SLA to ensure compliance and address any deviations.
Develop and execute plans for expanding Archive Storage capacity as needed to accommodate growing data requirements.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Archive Storage features and best practices.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Archive Storage performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
